definition[0]: to prevent someone from doing something or prevent something from happening
example[0]: His ex-wife had kept him from seeing his children.
example[1]: I hope I havenâ€™t kept you from your work.
example[2]: Put the pizza in the bottom of the oven to keep the cheese from burning.
example[3]: The play was so boring I could hardly keep myself from falling asleep.
definition[1]: to prevent someone from knowing something, by deliberately not telling them about it
example[4]: The government had wanted to keep this information from the public.
